result.execSummary:
The defendant Curtis J Wiggins was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Curtis J Wiggins in court with attorney Rodman Wells Streicher.  Martha Johanna Milanowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PSI reviewed and accepted by court.  Glenn David, Victim Witness Coordinator, reads statement on behalf of victim AG's parents.  Gerri Batiste makes statement.  Mary Sweet reads two letters on behalf of daughter AFS and also makes own statement.  Emily Komosa reads statement on behalf of SRJ and makes own statement.  SY makes statement.  Letter submitted by the defendant to court.  Wendy Schmidt makes statement.  Ct #1 and Ct #2: Sentenced to 40 years Wisconsin prison system to run concurrent.  20 years initial confinement, 20 years extended supervision.  Conditions: 1) Sexual offender treatment deemed appropriate, 2) No contact with victims or their families, 3) No contact with anyone under the age of 18 years old, 4) Must be in the company of a designated adult if off the premise of residence, 5) Restitution: Court allows 30 days for order to be provided by State, 6) Absolute sobriety and any AODA counseling deemed appropriate, 7) Anger Management, 8) Psychological counseling deemed appropriate, 9) Register as a sex offender, permanent registry, 10) Fined $518 including DNA surcharge.  Firearm and voting rights given.  DNA Order form provided.

Deft present in person w/Atty Streicher.  DA Milanowski present for State.  Amended information filed.  15CF58  Ct #1 Amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault:  granted.  NC plea entered.  Ct #2 Amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault:  granted.  NC plea entered.  Ct # 3&4 Dismissed but read-in:  granted.  15CF59  Ct #1 Amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault:  granted.  NC plea entered.  Ct #2 Dismissed but read-in:  granted.  17CF59 Ct #1 Amended to 2nd Degree Sexual Assault:  granted.  NC plea entered.  Ct # 2&3 Dismissed but read-in:  granted.  Case #16CF96, 16CF98, 17CF56, 17CF57, and 17CF58 Dismissed but read-in:  granted.  Plea questionnaire filed.  Rights given.  Found guilty.  Pre-Sentence Investigation orderd.  Sentencing set for 6/16/17 @ 9 am.  Bond revoked and deft remanded.
Arraignment May 13, 2015

Deft present in person w/Atty Streicher.  DA Milanowski present for State.  DA brings point before the court regarding conflict of interest.  ADA had represented deft in the past and removed himself from the case.  Defense objects for the record.  Court finds that no conflict of interest existed as to the DA prosecuting the case and also that the Court considers the conflict issue waived in that it had been noted and discussed thoroughly at the beginning of the case.  Motions for Audio visual Recordings:  granted as to the video for LW, but remainer of the other videos are denied.  State's Motion in Limine 1-5:  granted.  State's Motion in Limine 6: no ruling as the motion only states existing law.  State's Motion in Limine 7:  Ruling held.  State's Motion in Limine 8 & 9:  granted.  Court expects parties to work together regarding Motion #10.  Motions 11-13:  granted.  DA confers w/Atty Streicher about 3 victims under age of 12.  Court will allow audio to be admitted.   Age 13 or older, Court denies motion.  Deft Motion in Limine 1:  denied-Court already granted State's Motion to admit other acts.  Deft Motion in Limine 2:  denied.  Deft Motion in Limine 3-5:  granted.  Motion in Limine #6 Granted, but Officer Bill w/b allowed throughout the trial, and all victims may be present in court AFTER  they have testified, unless needed for recall.  Motion in Limine #7-10:  Granted.  Deft request the use of an expert and asks for postponement of trial to explore the issue of an expert:  denied.  State has possibly a resolution and plea agreement.  Tentative plea hearing set for 4/7/17 @ 2:30 pm.
